Description:
Incredible vineyard and country retreat awaits.
Set on approx. 20 acres in beautiful bushland near Dean, sits this wonderful, peaceful home. With 2 residences, a workshop, natural mineral water supply, a small vineyard and dam; this is truly an outstanding property for a relaxed lifestyle, entertaining or running a bed & breakfast.
Along a scenic, winding driveway, the main house is a well-constructed 2 storey sandstone brick with 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 2 living areas and study. Intelligently designed to capitalise on the stunning scenery, overlooking the picturesque dam and surrounding bush. The dam is stocked with trout, providing fresh fish for the kitchen or BBQ year-round.
Wood features prominently though the house, providing a feeling of warmth and keeping with the bush setting. The living/meals area has kauri pine floorboards and features a wood furnace. The meals area has large windows and sliding doors leading out to a patio. The kitchen is spacious with modern stainless-steel appliances, excellent cupboard and bench space, with the counter overlooking the adjoining meals and living room.
The Master bedroom is a generous size with BIR'S and connects to the large bathroom with spa bath and walk-in shower. There is a separate toilet, good-sized laundry and further study/optional bedroom to complete the ground floor.
The large upstairs bedrooms each have a balcony and share a bathroom. The vast living area has a vaulted cedar-lined ceiling, with a floor to ceiling window providing panoramic views.
A separate 2-bedroom residence previously used as a B&B offers beautiful views of the vineyard and has its own courtyard and spa filled using natural mineral water from the bore. The established vines are pinot noir and chardonnay and will produce enough grapes for 100 bottles in a good year.
** COVID 19 **
We welcome you to attend our properties for inspections, however we request that you only attend if not under any self-isolation conditions and are fit and healthy to do so. While attending an inspection, we request that all attendees show their ID and provide contact details before entering the property. We require attendees to maintain a respectable distance (1.5m apart) from the other individuals present. Finally, we request that you please refrain from touching items, fixtures and doors; if there is something that you require assistance with, our Sales Agent will be happy to help you. Thank you.

Description:
Escape the city! Family home set on approx 4 Acres
Tranquilly located with picturesque views, this fabulous family property simply delivers everything for growing families.
Four acres of open grassy plains, a 18x18m shed with concrete floor and three phase power, a chicken coop, two stables, a fruit orchard, grape vines, a dog run, three large water tanks and good fencing.
With distant views to Mount Beckworth, this property not only accommodates those who love to tinker and play outdoors, it also offers a four-bedroom family home with a freestanding wood heater, a brand-new split system along with cosy slab heating.
This brick veneer home is highly spacious with two living zones, a study, a modern kitchen with stainless steel appliances, a casual dining area, a large laundry and a big bathroom with a shower and soaking bath. New blinds have been installed, NBN is connected and floors are serviceable with durable tiles and cosy carpet.
A rear veranda adds further room to relax and/or entertain, with pleasant views across the acreage and enough room to set up a long Christmas table.
This property lies North of Creswick's buzzing main street, midway to the historic township of Clunes, along with approx. 30 minutes from Ballarat's heart - an ideal family retreat or a perfect hobby farm away from it all.

Description:
Exciting Parcel of Land at Front of Golf Court Resort
This is a fabulous opportunity to build your dream home at the Goldfields Resort Creswick. The block is situated at the front of the estate looking over wetlands, gum trees and the RACV resort. Spacious proportions will please with a fabulous 669m2 size and a frontage of 18.59 meters facing north and capturing great natural light into your future home. The first tee is just 100m away, as is the 19th hole with bar, restaurant and delightful views. You don't have to be a golfer to enjoy the resort as there are other attractions such as bird & animal life, walking & mountain bike tracks, tennis courts and BBQ facilities. This lifestyle is had just one hour from Melbourne, three minutes to the hub of Creswick, 20 minutes to Daylesford and ten minutes to Ballarat.

Description:
Griffin Estate - Creswick
This parcel is just one of the exciting releases of the Griffin Estate within Richard Court. This amazing parcel measures 469m2. Those seeking a north to north east facing block will be happy to find this option. This allotment has a 16.39m wide frontage and perfect for your smaller low maintenance dwelling. The court is 3 minutes back into the hub of Creswick, 11 minutes to Stockland Wendouree or 15 minutes to the CBD of Ballarat. The surrounds have you close to the Lindsay Douglas Reserve to enjoy footy, cricket, soccer, netball and lawn bowls. Needless to say, there is also great walking/bush tracks to enjoy nearby. The new estate will have you surrounded by young homes and families. Take advantage of the new government grant and secure your parcel and opportunity to live the Australian dream.

Description:
Getaway Close to Daylesford & Creswick
High and dry with an easy drive to Creswick and Daylesford, this large corner allotment in the gorgeous hamlet of Smeaton is ideal to begin your dream country retreat.
Travelling along the pretty tree lined avenue and sitting to the back of this generous allotment is a fabulous 63m2 shed with concrete floor, water and power connected which is divided into three rooms. To the side there is a modern caravan which sleeps two, with toilet, shower and kitchen facilities which is also included in the sale.
The brick and tin shed is a raw canvas to tinker at your leisure with a cosy wood heater and a number of side and front windows. This space creates a great work area, shelter from the elements and is roomy enough to set up for whatever is required.
There is a large 20-foot shipping container with 9 foot clearance beautifully disguised with trellis and creeper along with established trees and shrubs dotted around. The land is half an acre in size or 2000m2 with a frontage of about 50 metres and a depth of 40 metres.
To the side, there is a timber arbour and gate along with a front wire and steel fence delineating the boundaries. There is a concrete pipe culvert entrance to the sealed road and Smeaton Street runs to the North boundary.
Adding appeal to this sale, is a ride on lawn mower included in the sale, while lovely views to the West will encourage those looking for the perfect building site to call home. (STCA)
Low density Residential Zone, council property number 11923 under the Hepburn Shire planning scheme.

Description:
Ideal Building Block In Creswick
Take advantage of the Australian Government's Home Builder program which provides eligible owner-occupiers, including first home buyers, with a grant of $25,000 to build a new home.
Approx 548m2 with brand new fencing and all services available for connection, this level building site is within walking distance to a bus stop, the local milk bar (Flemos) and the Creswick North primary school, while being surrounded by house proud neighbours, and open rural views.
Just two minutes' drive to the middle of the vibrant Creswick township; this neat slice of land with a 21.6m frontage has all the makings for good country living at a price that will allow you to escalate your building plans with ease.
Call our agent and your architect and get things rolling!!

Description:
Well Presented Exceptional Value
On an impressive corner allotment, this beautifully presented single level weatherboard home sits proudly amidst mature gardens, just moments from all the action of Creswick's central township.
With an irresistible low maintenance format, this home is well considered with gas ducted heating, external sunblinds, a modern updated kitchen with stainless steel appliances, a dining zone, a cosy lounge, a light filled sun room with a large floor to ceiling bay window, a capacious family bathroom with a generous spa and shower along with a large laundry which could be easily adapted to suit your individual needs.
There are choices when it comes to the sleeping arrangements, with either two or three bedrooms, with stackable doors creating a fabulous open study area or office connecting directly to the lounge.
Offering ample storage, this premier property also provides a double carport, delightful gardens and a comfortable décor for families to enjoy.

Address: 1 St Georges Lake Road Creswick VIC 3363
Description:
Beauty of Country Living With Convenience of Being In Town
This wondrous home grants you the best of both worlds... bush outlook while being a three-minute walk to the hub of town. This surprise package is also larger than it seems with four generous bedrooms and two living areas. The master bedroom is not only spacious but offers an ensuite. There is a sunny L-shape formal lounge -dining that faces north-east. A second living area is open plan to the kitchen and grants access out to the decking and overlooks gum and blackwood tree, animal and birdlife. The kitchen is extremely functional and has great bench-space and stainless-steel appliances. The home boasts heating and cooling for all year comfort. The residence is set on a vast 1076m2 block allowing for loads of outdoor fun. To add to this, the home is 30 seconds to the bike park, reserve and walking tracks are practically at your front door. Don't forget during summer that St George's Lake is perfect for a swim. The convenience of having your favourite coffee, cake or shopping just one minute's drive is not to be looked over. Also of note is the high demand for rental properties if you seek to add to your port-folio.

Description:
A perfect weekender!
Enjoying a peaceful location, this treed 5.75 acre property offers opportunities as a perfect weekend getaway! The land is mainly fenced and has 2 dams. The weekender comprises 2 rooms and a bathroom with features including a combustion wood stove and wood-heater. Other infrastructure includes a caravan and sundry shedding. The property has good amenity to nearby Talbot and Clunes, plus Ballarat and Daylesford are within easy driving distance.

Description:
Lifestyle Mudbrick Home On 2 Acres In The Pyrenees
Sunrise through the gum trees, sunsets over the rolling paddocks, no neighbours and country seclusion: perfect for a weekend or holiday retreat or plenty of space to raise a family. This large allotment of approx. 8,100m2 or 2 acres, is suited to those who are looking for their own bush space that is ready to move in and make family memories.
Evansford is a delightful hamlet between Waubra, Clunes & Talbot, surrounded by the Dunach Nature Conservation Reserves. Thirty minutes will take you to Creswick or Avoca, 20 minutes for Maryborough and 30 minutes to Wendouree shopping and transport links. Secluded but not remote, this property offers school bus pick just up the road, along with a lifestyle environment to retreat and get away from it all.
The mudbrick and timber home, features 4 bedrooms, including external access from the master, to a secluded patio area, perfect for a morning coffee, plus a study or cosy second living area, timber raked ceilings, a modern family bathroom, laundry and open plan living/kitchen with a combustion heater. The dine in kitchen creates a warm, country atmosphere with gas and electric appliances and an attached undercover entertaining area; ideal for making the most of the outdoors.
There is a 12x6m powered shed with one lockable bay and two carports, a garden shed, wood storage, fire pit, a chicken coop and yards, various water tanks (approx. 40,000+L), a small dam with mains power, septic system and satellite NBN connected.
This property has an established vegetable garden with wicker beds and over 30 fruit trees, including apples, pears, stone fruits, lemons and figs which provide fresh produce and encourage a wide variety of friendly, native bird life. The gardens provide floral displays all year round from roses to natives.

Description:
WELCOMING OFF-GRID MUD BRICK COTTAGE ON SMALL ACRES
**VIRTUAL TOUR LINK BELOW** FARMING ZONE
Looking for a superb weekender in the Goldfields, then look no further as I have just found it and it could be just what you have been looking for! A great mudbrick home with 2 bedrooms, open plan lounge with wood fire, and a spacious kitchen and dining area. Off-grid with small solar system and generator, rainwater, LPG cooking and gas fridge and septic. Set on around 4 Acres this property has the bonus of having wildlife and fresh air in all directions. Misc sheds, space for parking and all within minutes of Talbot and a short drive to Maryborough in the heart of the Victorian Goldfields Fully fenced with 2 dams and some fruit trees. A wonderful space for a tree change, you MUST inspect if you are ready to buy and it has sparked your interest.

Description:
Natural Bush Setting on 4.6 Acres (Approx.)
Land is hard to find in Creswick. We offer an opportunity to secure a mostly natural bushland block with clearing for a building envelope. Situated four minutes from the heart of town to enjoy everything that it has to offer, including local Cafes, Pubs, Chemist, Doctors, boutique shops, butchers, newly opened IGA Supermarket just to name a few. Who wouldn't want to build their dream home here or keep the land as a weekend camping retreat whilst enjoying some of the local wildlife or prospecting to find that elusive gold nugget. Just past Log Cabin Lodge you will be treated with views to the East and the state forest to the West. If you are looking for that tree change or a bit more privacy this land will certainly suit. Do not hesitate, enquire today and come see for yourself.
* This information has been prepared to assist solely in the marketing of this property. While all care has been taken to ensure the information provided herein is correct, we do not take responsibility for any inaccuracies. Accordingly, all interested parties should make their own inquiries to verify the information.

Description:
Build Your Dream Home or Invest for the Future
This attractive allotment is found at the prestigious RACV Goldfields Resort in Creswick. The parcel is approx. 544m2 in size with a fabulous frontage of 21 meters that will easily hold a larger dwelling, the opportunity for dual access to this property, perfect to help store the boat, caravan or trailer. There are beautiful gum trees, walking & mountain bike tracks to enjoy, kangaroos and birdlife as well. An 18-hole championship golf course and tennis courts for budding the Golfer or upcoming tennis star. The block is a short stroll to the 19th hole to take advantage of the Café, Bar and restaurant. The Resort is 2 minutes to the hub of town, 10 minutes to Ballarat and 25 minutes to Daylesford. With Melbourne just an hour away, any home built could also be the perfect weekender. Investors should note the township has the lowest possible rental vacancy percentage. If you think your family deserves the loveliest of lifestyles, then this allotment is one to consider.
* This information has been prepared to assist solely in the marketing of this property. While all care has been taken to ensure the information provided herein is correct, we do not take responsibility for any inaccuracies. Accordingly, all interested parties should make their own inquiries to verify the information.

Description:
CRESWICK COTTAGE THAT SCREAMS POTENTIAL
Situated close to the centre of town, close to shops, cafes and restaurants in the highly sought-after Creswick. This home offers a wonderfully spacious block that stretches out to Macs Street, four good sized bedrooms, separate living area with gas ducted heating as well as a good size kitchen. Add to this instant gas hot water, NBN connection and a short walk to the train station. The garage is a great space for any mechanic with its own pit, also offering great storage space.
Features:
Approx. 933m2 land sized Zoned General Residential
The possibility of a subdivision (STCA)
15 minute drive to Ballarat, 25 minute drive to Daylesford and 90 minute easy access to Melbourne.
Close to the Creswick North primary school

Description:
THREE BEDROOM HOME ON 20 ACRES WITH SUSTAINABLE HUT.
* Three bedrooms all with BIRs.
* Ceiling fans in lounge room and master bedroom.
* All block out blinds and drapes.
* Open plan kitchen/living area.
* Bottled gas hot water and cooktop.
* Large wood fire.
* Small split system.
* Large laundry and linen with plenty of storage.
* Large decking all the way around the house.
* 55,000 litres of clean rain water.
* Fully fenced large house yard. Chicken coop. Wood shed. Storage shed.
* Four bay shed and fully lined double garage with power and aircon.
* Lined and functioning sustainable hut.
* Suitably fenced for large animals, horses or stock.
* 2 dams on property (one large and one smaller seasonal).
* Currently tenanted until January 2021.
This renovated three bedroom house has spacious living.
Enjoy the wildlife with colourful birds, kangaroo's and echidnas visiting regularly. Watch the sunrise and sunset with elevated mountain views.
Approximately 10,000 litres of fresh water behind large shed with gravity fed automatic trough.
Self Sustainable Hut - located on the property, this great little weekender could be available for friends/family to retreat to or the teenager! A 6,000kw generator in the little shed powers the hut.
This is included along with all the appliances (fridge and oven) and also all the wardrobes, drawers and unit. It also has instant hot water for the shower and kitchen (in the bath vanity).
Insights: 55 Bartletts Road, Red Lion VIC 3371 was last sold in 2020.

Description:
Ranch Style Living with Great Views
If affordable lifestyle living is your dream then this home is well worth your time to inspect. On a corner allotment of approximately 8 acres with leasing available on a further 2 acres at nominal cost, this home is warm and inviting.
Suitable for horses amongst other options, the land is divided into 6 paddocks and is fully fenced and gated. There is an industrial sized shed approx. 15m x 12m, 5 outdoor undercover stable yards and water available to the paddocks.
This stunning ranch style home contains 4 large bedrooms, a country style kitchen and bathroom which includes a corner spa, a slow combustion wood burner and a split system that allows year-round comfort.
The entrance to the home is laid with slate that continues to solid timber boards throughout adding to the country theme. One key feature of the home is a massive private decking and alfresco area overlooking your own land. The property has water tanks, dam water and town water.
Insights: 120 Henders Road, Broomfield VIC 3364 was last sold in 2020.
